1.q_string: Homogenous mixture of two or more than two components is called:

The mole fraction of urea in an aqueous urea solution containing \(900 \mathrm{~g}\) of water is \(0.05\). If the density of the solution is \(1.2 \mathrm{~g}\) \(\mathrm{cm}-3\), the molarity of urea solution is:

(Given data: Molar masses of urea and water are \(60 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mol}-1\) and \(18 \mathrm{~g}\) mol-1, respectively)

q_option: \(20 \mathrm{gm}\) of ethanol is disolved in \(80 \mathrm{gm}\) of solvent
\(20 \mathrm{gm}\) of ethanol is disolved in \(80 \mathrm{gm}\) of water
\(20 \mathrm{gm}\) of ethanol is disolved \(100 \mathrm{gm}\) of solvent
1.q_string: The molar volume of liquid benzene (density \(=0.877 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{ml}-1\) ) increases by a factor of 2750 as it vaporises at \(20^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) and that of liquid toluene (density \(=0.867 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mL}-1\) ) increases by a factor of \(7720\) at \(20^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\). A solution of benzene and toluene at \(20^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) has a vapour pressure of \(46.0\) torr. Find the mole fraction of benzene in the vapour above the solution.
A solution contains one mole of alcohol and four moles of water. What are the mole fractions of water and alcohol?
Which of the following pair will form an ideal solution?

Calculate the mass of ascorbic acid ( \(\mathrm{C}_{6} \mathrm{H}_{8} \mathrm{O}_{6}\) ) to be dissolved in \(75 \mathrm{~g}\) of acetic acid to lower its melting point by \(1.5^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\). Take \( \mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{f}}=3.9 \mathrm{~K} \mathrm{~kg} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\).
In an endothermic process, solubility increases with ______ in temperature.
A student slowly mixes salt into \(25\) ml of water until no more salt dissolves in it. The student could make more salt dissolve in the solution by:
If a solution prepared by dissolving \(1.0 g\) of polymer of molar mass 185,000 in \(450 mL\) of water at \(37^{\circ} C\), calculate the osmotic pressure in Pascal exerted by it?
A solution is obtained by mixing 300 g of 25% solution and 400 g of 40% solution by mass. Calculate the mass percentage of the solvent in resulting solution.
Determine the molarity of \(30 {~g}\) of \({CO}({NO})_{3} .6 {H}_{2} {O}\) in \(4.3 {~L}\) of solution.

q_option: Shows a negative deviation from Raoult's law
Shows a positive deviation from Raoult's law
1.q_string: A solution of acetone in ethanol:

\(12 {~g}\) of urea is present in 1 litre of solution and \(68.4 {~g}\) of sucrose is separately dissolved in 1 litre of another sample of solution. The lowering of vapour pressure of first solution is:
An aqueous solution of hydrochloric acid:
Which of the following binary mixtures will show negative deviation from Raoult's law?
Calculate molarity and molality of \(6.3 \%\) solution of nitric acid having density \(1.04 \mathrm{gcm}^{-3}(\mathrm{H}=1, \mathrm{~N}=14, \mathrm{O}=16)\)
Osmotic pressure is \(0.0821\) atm at a temperature of \(300\) \(K\). Find concentration in mole/liter.
Mixing up equal volumes of \(0.1 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{NaOH}\) and \(0.1 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{CH}{ }_{3} \mathrm{COOH}\) yields a solution that is __________.

At \(25^{\circ} C\), the solubility product of \(M g(O H)_{2}\) is \(1.0 \times 10^{-11}\). At which \(\mathrm{pH}\), will \(M g^{2+}\) ions start precipitating in the form of \(M g(O H)_{2}\) from a solution of \(0.001 M M g^{2+}\) ions?

A gas X with disagreeable odour reduces silver nitrate solution to give metallic silver and is itself oxidized to Y. Y is a dibasic acid with reducing properties. It is slowly oxidized in air to a tribasic acid Z. Though Z is a tribasic acid, it behaves in an aqueous solution mostly as a dibasic acid. When a mixture of X and \(\mathrm{N}_{2} \mathrm{O}\) is subjected to an electric spark, Z is obtained. Z is:
Volume of \(0.1 \mathrm{M} ~\mathrm{K}_{2} \mathrm{Cr}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{7}\) required to oxidize \(35 \mathrm{ml}\) of \(0.5 \mathrm{M} ~\mathrm{FeSO}_{4}\) solution is:
A \(5\) molar solution of \(\mathrm{H}_{2}\mathrm{SO}_{4}\) is diluted from \(1\) litre to a volume of \(10\) litres, the normality of the resulting solution will be:
Which one of the following pairs of solution can we expect to be isotonic at the same temperature?
Two solutions of a substance are mixed in the following manner: \(480 ~mL\) of \(1.5~ M\) first solution \(+520 ~mL\) of \(1.2 ~M\) second solution. What is the molarity of the final mixture?

At temperature \(327^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) and concentration \(\mathrm{C}_{1}\) the osmotic pressure of a solution is \(\mathrm{P}\) The same solution at concentration \(\frac{C}{2}\) and temperature \(427^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) shows the osmotic pressure of \(2\) atm. What will be the value of \(P\)?
